title: Drones In J&K, Rajasthan, Blackout In Several Cities: What We Know So Far
content: Pakistan has launched another attack tonight at many areas in northern India. Drones have been sighted over Jammu, Pathankot, Samba, Jaisalmer, and Barmer, according to initial reports.

title: Pak Attacks Again: Drones Intercepted In Multiple Places, Explosion In Pokhran
content: A swarm of drones from Pakistan was spotted in Jammu and Kashmir and Punjab on Friday evening, said the sources in the Army, adding that they are being engaged amid rising escalation between India and Pakistan.

title: India Pakistan Attack LIVE: Explosions Heard In Rajasthan, Drones Seen In Punjab
content: Operation Sindoor India Pakistan Attack LIVE Updates: A blackout was enforced and sirens went off after artillery firing and explosions were heard in Jammu this evening.

title: Health Ministry Cancels Leaves Of All Officers, Activates Emergency Protocol
content: Union Health Ministry and the Centre-run AIIMS, Safdarjung and Ram Manohar Lohia hospitals in New Delhi have cancelled leaves of all its officers and staffers indefinitely and activated emergency protocols amid a military standoff between India-Pak.

title: Turkey's Role In Focus After Pakistan's Military Escalation Against India
content: Pakistan's massive escalation along the Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu and Kashmir and the International Border in other states had a Turkish link.

title: Government Extends Closure Of 24 Airports Until May 15 Amid India-Pak Tensions
content: After Pakistan attempted to attack multiple cities in Northern India using drones, the Ministry of Civil Aviation on Friday extended the closure of 28 airports across the country until 15 May morning from 10 May.

title: N Sitharaman Asks Banks To Ensure Uninterrupted Services Amid India-Pak Tensions
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Friday asked banks to remain vigilant and take all steps to ensure uninterrupted services to customers in view of heightened military conflict between India and Pakistan.

title: PM Modi Meets All 3 Service Chiefs Amid Heightened Tensions With Pakistan
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, within a span of a few days, met the three service chiefs yet again on Friday as the India-Pakistan tensions escalated this week to the worst in nearly three decades.

title: What Is 'Asisguard Songar': Turkish Armed Drone Used By Pak Against India
content: The Pakistani military launched Turkish-made 'Songar' armed drones on Thursday night, the government said in a briefing today. The Songar, developed by Ankara-based defence company Asisguard, is the first armed drone in the Turkish military.

title: Kamal Haasan Defers Audio Launch Of Film 'Thug Life' Amid India-Pak Tension
content: Actor Kamal Haasan, today, rescheduled the audio launch for his upcoming film Thug Life, scheduled for 16 May amid a state of heightened alert in the country.

title: Security Stepped Up In Coastal Areas Of Odisha Amid India-Pak Tension
content: In the wake of the rising tensions between India and Pakistan, the Paradip Port in Jagatsinghpur district of Odisha has been put on high alert. The security has been ramped up, with additional forces stationed at major locations.

title: Deep-Rooted, Systemic Corruption Network In Key Tamil Nadu Departments: Probe Agency
content: ED Friday claimed to have unearthed a "deep-rooted" and systemic "corruption" network involving several consultants across key departments of the Tamil Nadu government during raids carried out earlier this week in a money-laundering case.

title: Sikkim Takes 'Proactive Safety Measures' Amid Tensions Along India-Pak Border
content: Sikkim Chief Minister Prem Singh Tamang has announced measures to tackle any problem arising because of the prevailing situation along the Pakistan border in India's north and west.

title: Air India Suspends Tel Aviv Flights Till May 25
content: Air India on Friday announced extending the suspension of its flights to and from Tel Aviv till May 25.

title: Saif Ali Khan's Attacker Urges Court To Declare His Arrest Illegal
content: The man accused of stabbing actor Saif Ali Khan on Friday moved an application before a court here seeking to declare his arrest as illegal and sought his release from jail.

title: "New Low Even For Pak": Government Says Places Of Worship In India Targeted
content: The government today accused Pakistan of "targeting places of worship" In India and said several "gurudwaras, convents and temples" along the border in Jammu and Kashmir were damaged by Pakistani shelling.

title: India's Long-Term Credit Rating Upgraded To 'BBB'. What It Means
content: India's long-term credit rating has been improved from 'BBB (low)' to 'BBB' by Morningstar DBRS, a global sovereign credit rating agency. The country's credit outlook has been revised to 'Stable' from 'Positive'.

title: Kartarpur Sahib Corridor Services Suspended Indefinitely: Foreign Secretary
content: Amid the escalation of tensions with Pakistan and indiscriminate firing from the neighbouring country across the Line of Control (LoC), Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri said that the services of the Kartarpur Sahib Corridor have been suspended.

title: What India Said On Link Between Strikes On Jaish And Daniel Pearl's Murder
content: Pakistan fired at least 300 drones, some of Turkish origin, toward India in a bid to target military installations in 36 cities in northern and western India, from Jammu and Kashmir to Punjab to Jaisalmer in Rajasthan.

title: Amazon, Flipkart Get Notice Over Sale Of Walkie Talkies Amid India-Pak Tension
content: Government watchdog CCPA has issued notices to 13 e-commerce players like Amazon and Flipkart for illegal sale of walkie-talkie devices on their platforms amid rising India-Pakistan tensions.

title: How India shut down Pak's second desperate bid to escalate tensions
content: India's air defence systems, crucial for protecting against aerial threats, include the S-400, Barak-8, and Akash missiles. Pakistan, heavily reliant on Chinese arms, has inducted HQ-9 series long-range surface-to-air missiles. The Harpy drone, an Israeli-made loitering munition, can target enemy air defences autonomously by detecting radar emissions, posing a threat to these systems.

title: India flags Pak’s terror financing at IMF; abstains from bailout vote
content: India-Pakistan tensions: India has voiced strong concerns at the IMF's Executive Board meeting regarding bailout packages for Pakistan, citing its poor track record and potential misuse of funds for terrorism. India highlighted Pakistan's repeated reliance on IMF programs, questioning their effectiveness and the country's economic policies.

title: Amazon founder loses World's Second-Richest man title to one of his biggest competitor
content: Mark Zuckerberg's fortune has surged past Jeff Bezos, making him the world's second-richest person, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. This shift occurred as Meta's shares outperformed Amazon's, with Meta reporting strong first-quarter revenue. Meanwhile, Elon Musk remains the wealthiest individual, boosted by increased Tesla shares following his commitment to reduce time spent on government duties.

title: 'Pakistan Super League 2025 postponed indefinitely'
content: The Pakistan Cricket Board has postponed the 2025 Pakistan Super League indefinitely. This decision follows the relocation of matches from Pakistan to the UAE. Escalating military tensions with India prompted the move. The Emirates Cricket Board was willing to host. PCB Chairman Mohsin Naqvi expressed regret over the relocation. The safety of players and staff is the priority.

title: Pak used civilian planes as shield to launch failed drone attack: India
content: India has accused Pakistan of endangering civilian lives by using passenger planes as shields during a failed drone and missile attack on May 7. Indian officials stated that Pakistan kept its airspace open, using civilian airliners as cover, despite knowing India would retaliate.

title: Watch: Delhi Capitals players' river outing in Dharamsala goes viral
content: Amidst rising military tensions between India and Pakistan, the IPL 2025 has been suspended for a week. A video surfaced showing Delhi Capitals players, including KL Rahul and Faf du Plessis, relaxing in Uttarakhand. The BCCI cited national security concerns and stakeholder interests as reasons for the suspension following recent events.

title: Elon Musk is no longer ‘Elon Musk’ on X; changes his profile name to…
content: Elon Musk has once again altered his X display name, this time to 'Gorklon Rust,' sparking speculation about its meaning. The moniker appears to blend references to Grok, Musk's AI chatbot, and the Rust programming language, potentially linked to xAI's infrastructure.

title: S-400, Spyder, Akash: What is in India's air defence arsenal?
content: In a significant escalation, Indian armed forces successfully intercepted and neutralized over 50 swarm drones launched by Pakistan along the Line of Control and International Borders on May 8-9, 2025. The coordinated drone attacks and ceasefire violations were met with a robust response, utilizing advanced air defense systems.

title: 'Destroyed radar, army positions': How India hit back after Pak's failed attack
content: India responded firmly to Pakistan's drone and artillery attacks on May 7 and 8, as confirmed by the Ministry of External Affairs. Pakistan initiated large-scale airspace violations, deploying hundreds of drones across the LoC and International Border. Indian forces retaliated with targeted drone strikes, destroying a Pakistani AD radar.

title: Neeraj Chopra Classic postponed amid escalating border tensions
content: Neeraj Chopra has postponed the inaugural NC Classic due to the escalating national security situation following Pakistan's aerial attacks on Jammu and other military stations. This decision prioritizes the safety of athletes and stakeholders amidst heightened tensions and retaliatory actions after Operation Sindoor. Chopra emphasized national solidarity, stating that standing with the nation is paramount during this critical time.

title: Elon Musk’s X: Indian government has asked us to block 8,000 accounts
content: X (formerly Twitter) has received orders from the Indian government to block over 8,000 accounts, including those of international news organizations and prominent users, citing violations of local laws. X has complied by withholding the accounts in India but disagrees with the government's demands, viewing it as censorship and a violation of free speech.

title: Several airports in India to be closed till May 15 - check list
content: Operation Sindoor impact on air travel: Due to ongoing India-Pakistan tensions under 'Operation Sindoor', several airports in North and North-Western India remain closed, with flight cancellations extended until May 15 by airlines like Air India, IndiGo. For flight travel at other airports, passengers are being advised to arrive at airports at least three hours before departure due to enhanced security measures, including secondary ladder point checks and restricted visitor access.

title: 'Turkey-made drones, civilian planes as shields': MEA on Pak's failed incursion
content: India has accused Pakistan of escalating tensions by launching hundreds of Turkish-made drones into Indian airspace, targeting military infrastructure and using civilian airliners as shields. Indian forces intercepted many drones, while Pakistan kept its airspace open, endangering commercial flights. India retaliated with strikes on air defense sites and terror launchpads, citing a prior terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: 'New low': India slams Pak for targeting 'gurdwaras, churches & temples'
content: Foreign secretary Vikram Misri condemned Pakistan's targeting of religious sites and schools, calling it a new low. Pakistan's actions, including airspace violations and drone incursions, escalated tensions following India's Operation Sindoor. Colonel Sofiya Qureshi reported numerous airspace violations and drone attacks, with investigations underway to determine the drones' purpose and origin, further straining the already tense relationship.

title: 'Deranged fantasy': MEA rejects Pak's claim India targeting own cities
content: Ministry of external affairs has strongly refuted Pakistan's accusations of Indian forces attacking its own cities, dismissing them as a "deranged fantasy" and disinformation. This denial follows Pakistan's retaliatory actions, including drone and missile attacks on Indian cities, which India claims were a response to Operation Sindoor, targeting terrorist sites.

title: Jordon Hudson, Bill Belichick's girlfriend, banned from UNC facility after controversy
content: Jordon Hudson, Bill Belichick’s girlfriend, has been banned from the University of North Carolina's football facility amid growing controversy following a CBS interview. Reports suggest Belichick’s family is concerned about the impact on his legacy. The situation is poised to either fade or escalate, with potential lasting consequences for both Belichick’s career and UNC’s football program.

title: 'We have venues': Ex-Eng captain pitches UK as host for remaining IPL matches
content: Amid escalating military tensions between India and Pakistan, the IPL 2025 has been suspended, prompting Michael Vaughan to suggest completing the tournament in the UK. With India's Test series against England looming, Vaughan's proposal offers a logistical solution, though the BCCI prioritizes national interest and solidarity with the government during the crisis. The remaining matches' fate remains uncertain.

title: What are Songar drones Pak used to target Indian military sites?
content: In a recent press conference, Colonel Sofiya Qureshi revealed that Pakistan launched a massive drone intrusion, sending 300-400 drones across 36 locations from Leh to Sir Creek, targeting Indian military installations. Indian armed forces successfully intercepted many drones using both kinetic and non-kinetic methods.

title: IPL 2025 players start dispersing, overseas lot to head back home too
content: Following security concerns and the suspension of the 2025 Indian Premier League for a week, franchises are arranging for players to return home. Overseas players, particularly anxious after an incident in Dharamsala, will be assisted by the BCCI in their departure. The BCCI has also released a statement expressing solidarity with the nation amidst recent events.

title: 'Seems right!': Donald Trump floats slashing China tariff to 80%
content: Donald Trump suggested potentially reducing tariffs on China to 80% before a weekend meeting, signaling a possible easing of trade war tensions. This proposal comes ahead of discussions in Switzerland focused on de-escalation, not a comprehensive agreement. Trump also highlighted a new trade deal with Britain and urged China to open its markets to the USA.

title: Pak def min gives absurd excuse for army's failure to withstand Op Sindoor
content: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif has made a bizarre claim that Pakistani forces deliberately avoided intercepting Indian drones to conceal strategic military locations. This justification follows India's 'Operation Sindoor,' precision strikes on terrorist spots, and the thwarting of Pakistani drone and missile attacks.

title: 'Not Gabbar Singh Tax but God-Sent Tax': Himanta's jab at Cong amid Op Sindoor
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma countered Rahul Gandhi's GST criticism, linking it to national security. Sarma defended GST, calling it a 'God-Sent Tax' that funds vital defense acquisitions like Rafale jets and S-400 systems. He emphasized that taxpayer money, collected through GST, strengthens India's security and growth.

title: 'Invoke emergency powers under civil defence rules': MHA to all states, UTs
content: Amid escalating India-Pakistan tensions, the home ministry has directed states and Union territories to implement civil defence measures under the 1968 Act. This directive follows Pakistani drone and missile strikes in Jammu and Kashmir and Rajasthan, retaliating against India's Operation Sindoor, which targeted terrorist sites after the Pahalgama attack. Indian air defence systems successfully intercepted most threats.

title: Blackouts & Pak's failed attacks: 10 things that happened in last 36 hrs
content: Tensions escalate between India and Pakistan as India launches 'Operation Sindoor' targeting terrorist camps in response to the Pahalgam attack, neutralizing over 100 terrorists. Pakistan retaliates with drone and missile strikes, prompting India to counter-attack key military bases. Blackouts, curfews, and air raid warnings grip the region, with the IPL suspended amidst the ongoing conflict.

title: 26/11 Mumbai attack plotter Rana remanded to judicial custody till June 6
content: Tahawwur Rana, accused in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks conspiracy, is now in judicial custody until June 6, 2025, following his extradition from the US. The NIA alleges Rana, a close associate of David Headley, was privy to the terror operation plans. Rana has sought permission to communicate with his family.

title: 'Buzdil' PM can't even take Modi's name: Pak MP slams Shehbaz Sharif
content: Pakistan's parliament witnessed heated debates as ministers clashed over the government's handling of the escalating conflict with India. MP Shahid Khattak criticized Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif for his perceived inaction and failure to condemn India and Prime Minister Modi. This occurred after India conducted precision strikes in PoK following terror attacks in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: IPL 2025 suspended for one week with immediate effect, confirms BCCI
content: The BCCI has suspended IPL 2025 for one week, effective immediately, due to recent events. This decision, impacting matches like Lucknow Super Giants versus Royal Challengers Bengaluru, follows concerns from franchisees, broadcasters, and sponsors. The board expressed solidarity with the nation, armed forces, and the government amidst ongoing challenges, prioritising national interest above all else.

title: Nifty, Sensex plunge over 1% as India-Pak tensions weigh
content: Operation Sindoor impact on Indian stock market today: Stock market indices Nifty and Sensex declined significantly by over 1 per cent on Friday amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan.

title: '1971 war was not remotely as terrifying': Residents of border areas shell-shocked
content: Poonch endured intense Pakistani bombardment, unlike anything experienced even during the 1971 war, prompting widespread fear and displacement. Shelling damaged religious sites and homes, resulting in casualties, including a tabla player, a kirtan singer and a maulvi. Residents are now fleeing, seeking safety as they express the urgent need for civilian bunkers amidst escalating tensions.

title: Govt empowers Army chief to mobilise Territorial Army for support
content: Amid escalating tensions with Pakistan, the defence ministry has granted the Army Chief expanded authority to mobilise the Territorial Army. This decision, enabled by Rule 33 of the Territorial Army Rules 1948, allows for the deployment of Territorial Army units to bolster security and support regular army operations across various commands.

title: Watch: Indian Army defuses projectile-like object in Amritsar
content: Tensions escalate as the Indian Armed Forces defuse a projectile in Amritsar following reported Pakistani air strikes along the western border in Jammu and Kashmir and Punjab. The Indian Army responded to ceasefire violations and drone attacks, asserting its commitment to national sovereignty. These events follow heightened tensions after the Pahalgam terror attack and India's subsequent Operation Sindoor.

title: IPL 2025: 'We will blast your stadium' - DDCA receives threat email
content: The Delhi and District Cricket Association (DDCA) received a threatening email on Friday morning, warning of an imminent explosion at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. The stadium, which serves as the home ground for the Delhi Capitals, was scheduled to host an IPL 2025 match between DC and Gujarat Titans on May 11.

title: India proposes cutting tariff gap to clinch trade deal with Trump
content: India has proposed significantly reducing its tariff differential with the US to under 4% to secure exemptions from existing and future tariffs. This move aims to boost the $129 billion bilateral trade, currently favoring India with a $45.7 billion surplus.

title: Watch: BSF foils infiltration bid by terrorists along Pakistan border
content: On the night of May 8, 2025, the BSF successfully thwarted a major infiltration attempt by Pakistan along the International Border in Samba district, Jammu and Kashmir. Simultaneously, the Indian Army reported that Pakistan's armed forces initiated multiple drone and munition attacks along the western border and engaged in numerous ceasefire violations along the LoC.

title: 'Look who’s behind him': Indian envoy shows photo as proof of Pak's link to terrorism
content: Indian High Commissioner Vikram Doraiswami confronted Pakistan on Sky News, displaying a photograph of Pakistani military officials attending the funeral of terrorists killed in India's Operation Sindoor. He highlighted the presence of UN-designated terrorist Hafiz Abdur Rauf, brother of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief, leading funeral prayers. Doraiswami questioned Pakistan's system of giving state funerals to terrorists, emphasizing the message it sends.

title: 'No need to panic': Indian Oil dispels shortage fears as tensions with Pak escalate
content: Amid rising India-Pakistan tensions, Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) assured the public that there is no shortage of petrol, diesel, or LPG. This statement follows panic buying fueled by social media posts showing long queues at fuel stations, particularly in border states.

title: Fully intact, undetonated Chinese PL-15 missile found in Hoshiarpur
content: Following the interception of missiles and drones fired by Pakistan, remnants of a missile were discovered in Punjab's Hoshiarpur. Initial reports suggest the recovered missile might be a Chinese PL-15, potentially launched from a Pakistani JF-17. If confirmed, India could gain valuable insights into its technology, enhancing its defense capabilities and strategic advantage against China.

title: PIB trolls Pak with 'Golmaal' jibe as Islamabad seeks 'loans', then retracts
content: The Press Information Bureau (PIB) mocked Pakistan's government after its Economic Affairs Division seemingly appealed for more international loans due to losses from conflict. While Pakistan claimed the account was hacked, Moody's warned that escalating tensions with India could negatively impact Pakistan's growth and financial stability. Moody's anticipates minimal impact on India, except for increased defense spending.

title: Can Pakistan afford a war with India? Here's a reality check
content: India-Pakistan tensions impact: Escalating tensions with India pose a significant threat to Pakistan's fragile economic recovery, potentially derailing its IMF bailout program and access to international financing. Pakistan's vulnerability stems from its high external debt, limited foreign exchange reserves, and reliance on international aid.

title: IPL suspended: Which window can be used to complete the remaining 16 matches?
content: Following the one week suspension of the IPL 2025, India's tour of Bangladesh and participation in the Asia Cup later this year are now highly improbable. The BCCI might utilise the August-September window to conclude the IPL if required, even if it means cancelling the scheduled tour and Asia Cup participation.

title: When was the last time IPL stopped midway?
content: The IPL 2025 has been suspended due to escalating regional tensions and national security concerns following missile firings by Pakistan. The decision impacts the final 16 matches, with BCCI prioritising player safety after an earlier game postponement and airspace closures. Evacuation efforts are underway, with potential rescheduling options being explored for later in the year.

title: India-Pakistan tensions: What’s closed, emergency protocols & more
content: Amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan, states bordering the neighboring country are implementing emergency measures. Delhi has heightened security and cancelled employee leaves, while Punjab, Jammu and Kashmir, Haryana, Rajasthan, and Himachal Pradesh have closed educational institutions following drone attacks.

title: Pak missile, drone attack foiled: How India's S-400 'Sudarshan Chakra' works
content: India's S-400 air defense system, known as "Sudarshan Chakra," successfully intercepted a Pakistani offensive involving drones and missiles. S-400 air defence system, with its extensive range and engagement capabilities, neutralised all incoming threats from Pakistan.

title: The NFL draft picks who landed with the perfect team: Bowen’s favorite early-round fits
content: Which rookies fit the best with their new NFL schemes? We picked out 15 who could thrive, including Seahawks guard Grey Zabel.

title: Browns GM: RB Chubb deal 'increasingly unlikely'
content: Browns general manager Andrew Berry said in a radio interview that he kept in contact with running back Nick Chubb and his representatives leading into the draft but hasn't been in "strong communication" since then.

title: UNC: Belichick's girlfriend welcome at school
content: North Carolina issued a statement saying Bill Belichick's girlfriend is still welcome at football facilities.

title: Giants top draft pick Carter picks jersey No. 51
content: Giants first-round draft pick Abdul Carter has chosen to wear No. 51 for his rookie season after flirting with the possibilities of donning the retired numbers of legends Lawrence Taylor (56) and Phil Simms (11).

title: Tiger's son, Charlie, fails to qualify for U.S. Open
content: Sixteen-year-old Charlie Woods, son of Tiger Woods, failed in his second attempt to qualify for the U.S. Open.

title: Texans rookie Higgins makes history with deal
content: Texans rookie wide receiver Jayden Higgins has become the first second-round pick in NFL history to receive a fully guaranteed contract.

title: Draymond upset with 'agenda' after drawing tech
content: Warriors star Draymond Green, who received his fifth technical foul of the playoffs Thursday night, expressed frustration over what he called an "agenda" to make him out to be an "angry Black man."

title: Irked Devers tells Red Sox he won't switch to 1B
content: Rafael Devers said the Red Sox approached him about the idea of filling in as Boston's first baseman but said it's not in his best interest to make another position switch.

title: Report: Pacers' Haliburton warned for G2 dance
content: Tyrese Haliburton received a warning, not a fine, for his celebration after the Pacers' Game 2 win at Cleveland in the East semifinals Tuesday, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

title: Why four of MLB's top closers are struggling -- and if they can bounce back
content: Emmanuel Clase is just one of baseball's elite 2024 relievers who has had issues this season. But all hope might not be lost ... yet.

title: The Thunder's defense has become their 'calling card'
content: The stifling unit that fueled Oklahoma City is facing its greatest test: Nikola Jokic and the Nuggets.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Can the Panthers dig out of an 0-2 hole?
content: The Cats are no strangers to rallying. Plus, get set for Stars-Jets, and get caught up on Thursday's action.

title: Welcome aboard: These are college football's top newcomers
content: From top recruits to big-time transfers, these players look to impact the College Football Playoff hopefuls.

title: 'The league is transforming': Inside the goals of WNBA's next CBA -- travel, roster size, and yes, pay
content: Increased salaries, revenue sharing and salary cap are among the issues being negotiated for WNBA's new CBA.

title: Why Lamine Yamal is already better than Messi in some ways, but still has room to improve
content: Lamine Yamal is only 17 and he's one of the world's best players, and he's probably the best teenager ever -- better than Messi was at that age.

title: Ancelotti's Real Madrid limbo explained
content: As Carlo Ancelotti prepares for what appears to be his final Clásico, how could his last few weeks play out?

title: Alonso to leave Leverkusen, Madrid beckons
content: Xabi Alonso has confirmed he is leaving Bayer Leverkusen at the end of the season, with the Spanish coach expected to join Real Madrid.

title: Liverpool's Salah named Footballer of the Year
content: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has been voted the Football Writers' Association (FWA) Footballer of the Year.

title: Arsenal's Russo wins FWA Player of the Year
content: Arsenal striker Alessia Russo has been voted the Football Writers' Association (FWA) Women's Footballer of the Year.

title: Liverpool boss Slot 'disappointed' by TAA exit
content: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot has said he is "disappointed" that defender Trent Alexander-Arnold has decided to leave the club this summer but has backed the Reds to adapt following his departure.

title: Amorim on Keane criticism: 'We can do better'
content: Ruben Amorim says Manchester United must accept criticism of their Premier League form, but insists he has had to sacrifice domestic games to chase Europa League glory.

title: Arteta targets Arsenal improvements to win trophy
content: Mikel Arteta has said he is "very clear" about what improvements need to be made at Arsenal next season after another trophyless campaign.=

title: Cunha using suspensions as a 'huge lesson'
content: Wolves forward Matheus Cunha has said he puts a lot of pressure on himself when it comes to discipline after being suspended twice and receiving a red card this season.

title: Man Utd, Spurs advance to all-English UEL final
content: Manchester United and Tottenham Hotspur will meet in the Europa League final on May 21, after both sides sealed wins in their semifinal ties on Thursday.

title: Different claims made to Pope Leo XIV's fandom after election
content: The Cubs and White Sox paid tribute to recently elected Pope (and Chicago native) Leo XIV amid a fandom debate.

title: Top prospects for the 2025 NHL draft: Updated rankings after U18s, draft lottery
content: There's a consensus on the top four -- after that, all bets are off. Who will your team select in June?

title: What should we expect from Shedeur Sanders in Cleveland?
content: Fifth-round draft picks don't typically carry the weight of expectations. Ahead of his first NFL practice, what's realistic for Sanders in a Browns uniform?

title: Kevin Durant to D.C.? How major league pickleball groups pulled off rare ownership swap
content: The Major League Pickleball franchises known as the D.C. Pickleball Team and Brooklyn Aces exchanged name rights.

title: NBA playoff futures: Pacers favored to win series over Cavs
content: An updated listing of the odds to win the NBA championship and Finals MVP following Wednesday's games.

title: At long last, Michigan State aligns with Larry Nassar survivors
content: Nassar survivors and MSU president Kevin Guskiewicz announced a new assessment of the school's culture.

title: Setting records and continuing a legacy: CJ Kirst is carrying on his family name
content: CJ Kirst is just the latest Kirst to make a name for himself and is leading Cornell into the NCAA tournament.

title: Raleigh in fantasy's top 25? Webb destined for Cy Young? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: 6-team mock draft: Is Ionescu a first-rounder?
content: Where did Sabrina Ionescu and the other stars on the Liberty land? Here's how our second fantasy women's basketball mock draft played out.

title: The ultimate guide to your draft
content: André Snellings provides a blueprint to follow for drafts, including his ideal selections in each round.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Cunha prefers Man United over Arsenal
content: Wolves forward Matheus Cunha is interested in Man United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: For 3rd night in a row, Pak attempts incursion: What we know so far
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: What must Arsenal fix to win the Premier League next season?
content: alejandro Moreno slams arsenal for their dependence on set pieces after their Champions League exit . the gunners will stand in two lines and applaud their opponents onto the pitch . it would be their third consecutive runner-up finish and raise further questions about manager Mikel Arteta's ability to cap five years of sustained progress .

title: Projecting how good the expansion Valkyries will be in their inaugural WNBA season
content: the WNBA is the first expansion team in women's sports history to do so prior to its first season . the franchise surpasses 15,000 season-ticket deposits . a lot of eyes are on the Valkyries as teeming with a crowd of fans .

title: 2025 college baseball hitter rankings: The best hitters in the game
content: the best hitters in college baseball do I want in the batter's box for me right now? . the best cleanup hitter in Omaha, Nebraska is junior, 24 HRs, 52 RBIs, .326 BA Neville has been going off this year .

title: Ranking this weekend's fights: From Navarrete-Suarez to Lubin-Holmes
content: sportsmail breaks down the best card and ranks all the notable fights this weekend . the 36-year-old wants to close his career with a world title fight at the City Ground . he is at least boxing in front of his home city fans in Nottingham .

title: Post-spring Way-Too-Early Top 25: Where do Texas and Notre Dame rank?
content: the college football calendar is finally slowing down for a few weeks . it's a good time for the second edition of the 2025 Way-Too-Early Top 25 . there's no. 1 with Penn State jumping from no. 3 .

title: Pound-for-pound rankings: Inoue retains spot, Canelo falls
content: Naoya Inoue beats Ramon Cardenas in the eighth round to retain his undisputed junior featherweight title . inoue threw only 152 punches, the second-lowest total in a 12-round fight in CompuBox's 40-year history . canelo now moves on to a fight against Terence Crawford on sept. 12 in Las Vegas .

title: Power Rankings: Tigers make top-5 debut as Mariners, Royals are on the rise
content: the battle between the national league powerhouses for the no. 1 spot continues in week 6 . los Angeles is retaking the top spot from new york, with the Tigers breaking in at the No. 5 spot . the Yankees, the Mariners and the royals are the week's biggest risers .

title: Is there a path for Belal to catch GSP?
content: belal "Remember the Name" Muhammad won the welterweight title last month . the nine-year veteran has been overlooked by fans and opponents alike . "i don't need the world to believe in me," he said .

title: Bold predictions on Matthew Golden, Travis Hunter, other top rookies
content: Packers head coach Matt LaFleur joins "the Pat McAfee Show" and talks about adding Matthew Golden to his roster . a dozen of our experts weigh in with their opinions on everything that went down in Green Bay .

title: 📈 Metallica rocks Va. Tech with 'Enter Sandman'
content: over 60,000 fans gathered at Virginia Tech's Lane Stadium for a night that created ground tremors . the iconic metal band finally brought their song "Enter Sandman" in front of this dedicated fan base . it was so well-received that it brought a seismic shift to the stadium .

title: Congress holds ‘Jai Hind Yatra’ to express solidarity with armed forces
content: Leaders rally across States amid heightened India-Pakistan tensions; party asserts strong support for national security

title: Stay off streets, stay home: J&K CM Omar Abdullah after loud blasts in Jammu
content: Omar Abdullah urges calm as blasts, blackout and sirens reported in Jammu; residents advised to remain indoors amid heightened tensions

title: Railways approves survey for mega terminal at Devanahalli to decongest Bengaluru’s rail network
content: The terminal is expected to be located along the Yelahanka–Devanahalli–Chikkaballapur corridor and will serve as the city’s fourth major coaching terminal

title: The Hindu Huddle begins with focus on border threats
content: Hosting a packed auditorium at the Taj West End, The Hindu Huddle also brought its viewers a diverse range of panel discussions on contemporary subjects including on climate change, AI, women’s cricket, liberal education, and how women directors are transforming the landscape of cinema across India.

title: Grand library in Tirunelveli will be named after Quaid -E-Millath: CM
content: Steps will be taken to establish a Chair on Islamic Tamil literature in University of Madras, says the Chief Minister at the inauguration of ninth World Islamic Tamil Literature conference

title: It is not a court’s duty to tell media to delete or take down content: SC
content: The verdict by a Bench of Justices A.S. Oka and Ujjal Bhuyan came in a challenge to a Delhi High Court order directing the takedown or deletion of online content related to a defamation case between ANI and Wikimedia Foundation

title: BMRCL refuses to disclose fare fixation committee report despite public, political pressure
content: The Hindu had also filed an RTI application in February 12 with the Union Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs seeking a copy of the FFC report. The ministry subsequently transferred the application to the Managing Director of BMRCL. However, no response has been received to date.

title: DEEP initiative shows spectacular result in Class 12 examinations in Nagapattinam district
content: The district has recorded a pass percentage of 96.03 in 2024-25 and risen to 11th place in the State from 37th place last year when it recorded a pass percentage of 91.19

title: Tourists from Karnataka struggle to return from north Indian destinations
content: Many people are changing their travel destinations from ones in the northern part of the country to locations in Kerala and Karnataka

title: Release of HNSS water to Rayalaseema region by July 10, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: The Chief Minister said that the project will be a milestone in the State government’s move to make Rayalaseema a water-abundant region

title: Former Chief Secretary Sarada Muraleedharan inaugurates The Hindu Civil Service Gateway Summit 2025 in Thiruvananthapuram
content: Ability of bureaucrats to play transformative roles is what can set them apart in the Civil Services, says the former Chief Secretary

title: Farmers should switch over to multi-cropping for better returns, says official
content: Special Chief Secretary of the State Agriculture and Cooperation Department also emphasises importance of natural farming and awareness of proper farming methods to get higher yields

title: The Hindu Huddle 2025: Role of multilateral regime remains relevant in fight against climate change: experts
content: The planet is warming because of human activities, and it is warming much faster than our models have anticipated, says expert at The Hindu Huddle.

title: Tamil Nadu government opens help desk for the Tamils stranded in Jammu and Kashmir
content: The desk operates in the Tamil Nadu House in New Delhi. As many as 52 Tamil Nadu students, studying in the border State, and four others on a trip to the region have requested the government for help in returning home

title: DLSA official inspects children’s home in Eluru, tells staff to teach technical skills to inmates
content: K. Ratna Prasadu stresses need to come out with ways to help children who have been granted bail but are unable to afford the bail bonds

title: Narendra Modi alone can shield India from terrorism, says Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: Referring to Operation Sindoor, the Chief Minister underlines the need to stand by our brave soldiers who protect the nation’s sovereignty and democracy

title: Civil defence preparedness exercise at Raichur Thermal Power Station
content: It was aimed at assessing and strengthening coordination between civil defence personnel and armed forces during crisis situations

title: RSS lauds armed forces, Centre for decisive action against Pakistan-sponsored terrorists
content: RSS praises India’s military action against Pakistan, calling it “necessary” for national security and urging unity during challenging times

title: APCRDA offers quick solutions to many issues raised by Amaravati farmers on Grievance Day
content: Most of the complaints related to land issues while some farmers reported technical glitches in the GIS portal concerning allocation of returnable plots

title: Food Safety Commission finds grave lapses in public distribution system in Dharwad
content: After observation for five days, the commission has recommended that the district administration take tough action

title: COMEDK UGET 2025 postponed in select city centres
content: The examination will proceed as scheduled for all other candidates in other cities on May 10 at the time slots/session mentioned in the Test Admission Tickets.

title: Archbishop of Varapuzha reminisces Pope Leo XIV’s Kerala visits
content: He narrated how the new Pope visited Augustinian priests in Kerala and also dedicated priests when Daniel Acharuparambil was the Varapuzha Archbishop in 2004

title: The Hindu Huddle 2025: Not against delimitation but south India should get 33% representation, says Telangana CM Revanth Reddy
content: The Southern States, which strictly implemented the family planning and reduced population, would stand to lose in the present model of delimitation exercise, says Telangana CM

title: Five-day expert panel meet on fundamental English-Malayalam glossary of commerce concludes
content: Creation of Malayalam commerce glossary a big step forward for commerce education in regional languages, say experts

title: Banks assure Finance Minister of cybersecurity preparedness in light of tensions with Pakistan
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman reviews India’s financial institutions’ cybersecurity preparedness amidst border tensions, ensuring quick responses to cyberattacks

title: Preventive measures ramped up as Nipah patient remains critical
content: Collector, DMO directed to take action against those refusing to share information with health officials

title: Security strengthened at Kollam Civil Station
content: District administration moves comes in the context of threat messages targeting government institutions

title: Govt. to train, issue licenses to 5,000 surveyors soon to implement new land records law properly
content: Role of surveyors becomes crucial as attaching land maps with registration documents is mandatory under Bhu Bharati Act

title: IIM-T scores high with summer, final placements
content: This year’s drive recorded a 53% increase in the highest stipend offered in the manufacturing, pharma, hospitality, and logistics (MPHL) sector

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . england's assistant was trapped by an assistant in the uk on tuesday night . the eludahi district of london has been hailed as a 'failure' by the u.s. government .
